Candidate No.:   61652  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:    Huddersfield  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
1st BEng Honours – Mechanical Engineering   
 
 
CAREER SUMMARY  
 
Current Company  (Pharmaceutical FMCG Industry)  
Job Title: Project Manager / Project Engineer 2 nd July 2018 - Current  
 
• Project management and implementation of new HVAC & site mechanical services gantry, interlinked with a 
large manufacturing expansion project (ongoing ~£1.1m)  
• New Machinery & Line Process / Layout Optimisation for Suppositories Filling Line (~£100k)  
• Replacing largest unplanned equipment downtime with installation of a new labeller on a creams filling line 
(~£400k), and streamlining the value process  
• Driving the procurement and CAPEX processes between £1 and £1.1m  
• Multiple projects associated with transferring SKU’s to unsuitable lines (consisting of modifications to existing 
assets)  
• Leading SKU rationalisation & equipment modification projects, on number of pharmaceutical liquids/creams 
manufacturing lines  
• Design scoping and fit out of Class 7 -8 GMP areas  
• Managing and leading validation on new SKU’s and asset introductions  
• Experience leading and coordinating construction projects to support project requirements and general site 
growth (engineering workshop refurb and site mechanical services  gantry; above existing buildings)  
• Frequently assisting other PMs in their projects during challenging periods or absences  
 
 
KEY SKILLS  
 
• Great verbal and written communication and presentation skills to SGL (Senior Group Leaders) and HOD 
(Heads of Departments)  
• Stakeholder collaboration & expectation management  
• Experienced in Microsoft Word, Microsoft PowerPoint, 2D Design, SolidWorks and AutoCad.  
• Technical documentation writing (User Requirement Specifications, validation and engineering documentation 
related  to the validation and functionality of a new or pre -existing assets)  
• Understanding of health and safety management within a manufacturing organisation  
 
 
COMMENT  
 
A dedicated, hardworking individual that is looking to continuously develop and grow in the field of  engineering, 
having excellent leadership skills and great at working and leading a multi -disciplinary team. Being a quick learner 
 and great at picking up new skills, with the strength of being able to efficiently adapt to the environment. 
Instinctively ac tion-orientated with the strong ability to communicate effectively and with the drive to always 
improve. Aspirations include growing and developing into a successful and industrious engineer, who enjoys 
challenges and loves the concept of solving real -life problems, adapting, being creative and innovative however 
tough it may be.  
 
 
For further information please contact Thomas -Jan Johnston  on 01695 570 696  or email tomj@johnston -
vere.co.uk
